values.description:
Current the cheats and non-cheats rosapi tests have the same test-name, which makes it a bit confusing to parse the test output in Jenkins. This renames the cheats tests to better match their filename.
~~~
for i in `find ros/atlas_utils/test | grep 'cheats.*test$'`
do
  testName=`basename -s .test $i`;
  sed -i -e "s@test-name=\(.\)[a-z_0-9]*.@test-name=\1$testName\1@" $i;
done
~~~
values.title: Rename test-name in cheats tests to differ from non-cheats tests.

summary.raw:
Current the cheats and non-cheats rosapi tests have the same test-name, which makes it a bit confusing to parse the test output in Jenkins. This renames the cheats tests to better match their filename.
~~~
for i in `find ros/atlas_utils/test | grep 'cheats.*test$'`
do
  testName=`basename -s .test $i`;
  sed -i -e "s@test-name=\(.\)[a-z_0-9]*.@test-name=\1$testName\1@" $i;
done
~~~
summary.html:
Current the cheats and non-cheats rosapi tests have the same test-name, which makes it a bit confusing to parse the test output in Jenkins. This renames the cheats tests to better match their filename.

for i in `find ros/atlas_utils/test | grep 'cheats.*test$'`
do
  testName=`basename -s .test $i`;
  sed -i -e "s@test-name=\(.\)[a-z_0-9]*.@test-name=\1$testName\1@" $i;
done

values.description:
In all the merge confusion, I missed several important pieces of the fixes to the drc_vehicle model and plugin. I believe this will also resolve issue #253 (collisions can cause forward/reverse switch to toggle), since the switch was not holding position.

These changes were all approved in pull request #238, but unintentionally omitted from pull request #252.
values.title: Fix missed changes from pull request #252, fix issue #253

summary.raw:
In all the merge confusion, I missed several important pieces of the fixes to the drc_vehicle model and plugin. I believe this will also resolve issue #253 (collisions can cause forward/reverse switch to toggle), since the switch was not holding position.

These changes were all approved in pull request #238, but unintentionally omitted from pull request #252.
summary.html:
In all the merge confusion, I missed several important pieces of the fixes to the drc_vehicle model and plugin. I believe this will also resolve issue #253 (collisions can cause forward/reverse switch to toggle), since the switch was not holding position.

These changes were all approved in pull request #238, but unintentionally omitted from pull request #252.

values.description:
Initial implementation for atlas commander. It allows to send via rosrun the keys to teleop script.

It inherits from teleop and overload the needed methods, it should have a minimal impact on existing keyboard script.

*vrc_task_1_commander.launch* is include to approach the robot to vehicle. This is not deterministic so fails can occur.
values.title: Auto teleop tool for testing

summary.raw:
Initial implementation for atlas commander. It allows to send via rosrun the keys to teleop script.

It inherits from teleop and overload the needed methods, it should have a minimal impact on existing keyboard script.

*vrc_task_1_commander.launch* is include to approach the robot to vehicle. This is not deterministic so fails can occur.
summary.html:
Initial implementation for atlas commander. It allows to send via rosrun the keys to teleop script.

It inherits from teleop and overload the needed methods, it should have a minimal impact on existing keyboard script.

vrc_task_1_commander.launch is include to approach the robot to vehicle. This is not deterministic so fails can occur.

values.description:
This pull request should fix issue #233 by improving the steering responsiveness of the polaris, and should be tested in conjunction with [gazebo_models pull request 38](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/38/polaris-rear-differential-parameter/diff).

* <max_steer> sdf parameter added to DRCVehicle plugin, used to specify max steering (before Ackermann adjustment)
* Increase torque available for steering at wheels
* Adjust grass_plane friction values to 0.5 in each direction
values.title: Fix #233, polaris steering responsiveness

summary.raw:
This pull request should fix issue #233 by improving the steering responsiveness of the polaris, and should be tested in conjunction with [gazebo_models pull request 38](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/38/polaris-rear-differential-parameter/diff).

* <max_steer> sdf parameter added to DRCVehicle plugin, used to specify max steering (before Ackermann adjustment)
* Increase torque available for steering at wheels
* Adjust grass_plane friction values to 0.5 in each direction
summary.html:
This pull request should fix issue #233 by improving the steering responsiveness of the polaris, and should be tested in conjunction with gazebo_models pull request 38.

  • <max_steer> sdf parameter added to DRCVehicle plugin, used to specify max steering (before Ackermann adjustment)
  • Increase torque available for steering at wheels
  • Adjust grass_plane friction values to 0.5 in each direction

values.description:
- store joint damping coefficient for the model.
  - pass through `kp_velocity` to cfm damping in the range of (model damping, max allowed joint implicit damping).
  - calculate force applied through implicit joint damping from `kp_velocity` pass through (from the component of `kp_velocity` larger than model damping coefficient) and truncate the control force accordingly.
values.title: issue #194, increase upper limit of joint damping coefficient settings.  pass through kp_velocity to implicit joint damping.

summary.raw:
- store joint damping coefficient for the model.
  - pass through `kp_velocity` to cfm damping in the range of (model damping, max allowed joint implicit damping).
  - calculate force applied through implicit joint damping from `kp_velocity` pass through (from the component of `kp_velocity` larger than model damping coefficient) and truncate the control force accordingly.
summary.html:
• store joint damping coefficient for the model.
  • pass through kp_velocity to cfm damping in the range of (model damping, max allowed joint implicit damping).
  • calculate force applied through implicit joint damping from kp_velocity pass through (from the component of kp_velocity larger than model damping coefficient) and truncate the control force accordingly.

Following discussion on issue #267 I'm removing the quals related tests and some other old which I believe are really not given a relevant testing results anymore.

It will also fix most of the failing tests, as appreciated while testing issue #267.

values.description:
- removed deferred loading thread.
  - changed gazebo_ros_force plugin to use `Link::AddForce` and `Link::AddTorque`
  - reorganize startup sequence in AtlasPluign into:
      - load from ros param server.
      - advertise ros publication.
      - add ros subscribers.
      - advertise ros service.
      - start thread for ros custom callback queue for AtlasPlugin.
      - connect `AtlasPlugin::UpdateStates` to world update start.
  - Modify VRCPlugin startup into `bdi_stand` to:
      - go directly into PID'd "Stand" pose.
      - drop robot at sim time = 1 sec.
      - switch directly into AtlasSimInterface Stand mode at sim time = 2 sec.
values.title: fix startup race condition

summary.raw:
- removed deferred loading thread.
  - changed gazebo_ros_force plugin to use `Link::AddForce` and `Link::AddTorque`
  - reorganize startup sequence in AtlasPluign into:
      - load from ros param server.
      - advertise ros publication.
      - add ros subscribers.
      - advertise ros service.
      - start thread for ros custom callback queue for AtlasPlugin.
      - connect `AtlasPlugin::UpdateStates` to world update start.
  - Modify VRCPlugin startup into `bdi_stand` to:
      - go directly into PID'd "Stand" pose.
      - drop robot at sim time = 1 sec.
      - switch directly into AtlasSimInterface Stand mode at sim time = 2 sec.
summary.html:
• removed deferred loading thread.
  • changed gazebo_ros_force plugin to use Link::AddForce and Link::AddTorque
  • reorganize startup sequence in AtlasPluign into:
    • load from ros param server.
    • advertise ros publication.
    • add ros subscribers.
    • advertise ros service.
    • start thread for ros custom callback queue for AtlasPlugin.
    • connect AtlasPlugin::UpdateStates to world update start.
  • Modify VRCPlugin startup into bdi_stand to:
    • go directly into PID'd "Stand" pose.
    • drop robot at sim time = 1 sec.
    • switch directly into AtlasSimInterface Stand mode at sim time = 2 sec.

values.description:
This will allow higher bandwidth damping at the joints using the cfm damping mechanism in gazebo. To ensure that joint effort limits are still enforced, the cfm damping effort (dampingEffort) is estimated based on the current joint velocity (this->atlasState.velocity[i]). The dampingEffort is then used to offset the effort clamping.

The maximum damping gain is limited to 50 times the max joint effort / max joint velocity in an effort to maintain simulation stability. Also, the minimum damping value of 0.1 is retained, also for simulation stability.
values.title: Use kp_velocity gain to set cfm damping at joints

summary.raw:
This will allow higher bandwidth damping at the joints using the cfm damping mechanism in gazebo. To ensure that joint effort limits are still enforced, the cfm damping effort (dampingEffort) is estimated based on the current joint velocity (this->atlasState.velocity[i]). The dampingEffort is then used to offset the effort clamping.

The maximum damping gain is limited to 50 times the max joint effort / max joint velocity in an effort to maintain simulation stability. Also, the minimum damping value of 0.1 is retained, also for simulation stability.
summary.html:
This will allow higher bandwidth damping at the joints using the cfm damping mechanism in gazebo. To ensure that joint effort limits are still enforced, the cfm damping effort (dampingEffort) is estimated based on the current joint velocity (this->atlasState.velocity[i]). The dampingEffort is then used to offset the effort clamping.

The maximum damping gain is limited to 50 times the max joint effort / max joint velocity in an effort to maintain simulation stability. Also, the minimum damping value of 0.1 is retained, also for simulation stability.

values.reason: Not target to default. Get the increase_damping_limits first.

values.description:
Support for test the gzlog stop and check correct log file in all three vrc arenas. One extra long run (3 min) is included for vrc 1.

The script gzlog_stop_checker will also measure and write the result of duration while waiting for the log to be complete and the max of memory used by the gzserver process.

Finally, I've included a longrun test for zlib so we can start consider on using it and compare time and memory results respect to bzip2.
values.title: New testing for gzlog stop on vrc arenas

summary.raw:
Support for test the gzlog stop and check correct log file in all three vrc arenas. One extra long run (3 min) is included for vrc 1.

The script gzlog_stop_checker will also measure and write the result of duration while waiting for the log to be complete and the max of memory used by the gzserver process.

Finally, I've included a longrun test for zlib so we can start consider on using it and compare time and memory results respect to bzip2.
summary.html:
Support for test the gzlog stop and check correct log file in all three vrc arenas. One extra long run (3 min) is included for vrc 1.

The script gzlog_stop_checker will also measure and write the result of duration while waiting for the log to be complete and the max of memory used by the gzserver process.

Finally, I've included a longrun test for zlib so we can start consider on using it and compare time and memory results respect to bzip2.

values.description:
Initial implementation of full state feedback control, needs correctness and performance testing.

To save time merging later, preemptive merge of pull request #284 in this patch.
values.title: Full state feedback control.  Note:  This will be much easier to review after pull request #284 (startup_threading_fix) is merged

summary.raw:
Initial implementation of full state feedback control, needs correctness and performance testing.

To save time merging later, preemptive merge of pull request #284 in this patch.
summary.html:
Initial implementation of full state feedback control, needs correctness and performance testing.

To save time merging later, preemptive merge of pull request #284 in this patch.

values.reason: It's a nice feature, but a further distraction from hardware, as the real robot controller will not support full state feedback.  Recommending alternative strategy: [simulation control synchronization](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/2.6/controller_synchronization).
